COMMAND.name: show ip route

PARAM.name: connected
PARAM.help: Connected routes (directly attached subnet or host)

COMMAND.name: show ip dhcp-relay

PARAM.help: Display IP DHCP relay information in brief
PARAM.name: brief

PARAM.help: Display IP DHCP relay information in detail
PARAM.name: detailed
resolve-via-default
PARAM.help: Enables default route based nexthop resolution

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configures default route based IPv4 nexthop resolution within default VRF.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to enable default route based IPv4 nexthop resolution within default VRF.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# ip nht resolve-via-default

PARAM.name: resolve-via-default
PARAM.help: Disables default route based nexthop resolution

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigures default route based IPv4 nexthop resolution in default VRF.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to disable default route based IPv4 nexthop resolution within default VRF.

EXAMPLE.summary: IPv4 nexthop tracking nht command examples

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# no ip nht resolve-via-default

COMMAND.name: no ip address
COMMAND.help: Delete IPv4 address(es) on the interface

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure IPv4 unnumbered interface by borrowing IPv4 address from the Donor interface.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure IPv4 unnumbered interface at the interface level.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# interface Ethernet 0 sonic-cli(conf-if-Ethernet0)# ip unnumbered Loopback1

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigure IPv4 unnumbered interface.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to unconfigure IPv4 unnumbered interface at the interface level.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# interface Ethernet 0 sonic-cli(conf-if-Ethernet0)# ip unnumbered Loopback1 sonic-cli(conf-if-Ethernet0)# no ip unnumbered

COMMAND.name: ip dhcp-relay
COMMAND.help: Configure DHCP relay on an interface

PARAM.help: Configure the VRF in which the server resides
PARAM.name: vrf

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configures DHCPv4 relay on an interface.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure a DHCPv4 relay on an interface.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# interface Ethernet 12 sonic-cli(conf-if-Ethernet0)# ip dhcp-relay 9.0.0.9

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configures the source IP address to be used for relaying the DHCP packets.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure the source-interface.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# interface Ethernet 12 sonic-cli(conf-if-Ethernet0)# ip dhcp-relay source-interface Ethernet36

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure the link-selection suboption on an interface.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure the link-selection suboption on an interface.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# interface Ethernet 12 sonic-cli(conf-if-Ethernet0)# ip dhcp-relay link-select

COMMAND.name: ip dhcp-relay max-hop-count
COMMAND.help: Set max hop count for DHCP Relay packets

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configures the maximum hop count for the DHCP packet.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure the maximum hop count for the DHCP packet.

EXAMPLE.summary: Configure dhcp relay max hop count

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# interface Ethernet 12 sonic-cli(conf-if-Ethernet0)# ip dhcp-relay max-hop-count 9

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure the VRF selection option.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure the VRF selection option.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# interface Ethernet 12 sonic-cli(conf-if-Ethernet0)# ip dhcp-relay vrf-select

COMMAND.name: ip dhcp-relay policy-action
COMMAND.help: Configure the policy for handling of DHCPv4 relay options

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure the policy for handling of DHCPv4 relay options.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure the policy for handling of DHCPv4 relay options.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# interface Ethernet 12 sonic-cli(conf-if-Ethernet0)# ip dhcp-relay policy-action REPLACE

COMMAND.name: ip dhcp-relay circuit-id
COMMAND.help: Configure the DHCPv4 relay circuit-id format

PARAM.help: Sends the name of the interface; for example, Vlan100 (default).
PARAM.name: circuitId1

PARAM.help: Sends the hostname followed by interface name; for example, sonic:Vlan100.
PARAM.name: circuitId2

PARAM.help: Sends the name of the physical interface; for example, Eth1/2
PARAM.name: circuitId3

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure the DHCPv4 relay circuit-id format.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure the DHCPv4 relay circuit-id format.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# interface Ethernet 12 sonic-cli(conf-if-Ethernet0)# ip dhcp-relay circuit-id %i

COMMAND.name: ip dhcp-relay smart-relay
COMMAND.help: Enable the DHCP smart relay mode

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Enable the DHCP smart relay mode.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to enable the DHCP smart relay mode.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# interface Ethernet 12 sonic-cli(conf-if-Ethernet0)# ip dhcp-relay smart-relay

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configures IP helper server address in non-default vrf for an interface.

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# interface Ethernet 12 sonic-cli(conf-if-Ethernet0)# no ip dhcp-relay vrf-select

COMMAND.name: no ip dhcp-relay policy-action
COMMAND.help: Set default policy action for DHCP relay packets

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigure the policy for handling of DHCPv4 relay options.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to unconfigure the policy for handling of DHCPv4 relay options.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# interface Ethernet 12 sonic-cli(conf-if-Ethernet0)# no ip dhcp-relay policy-action

COMMAND.name: no ip dhcp-relay circuit-id
COMMAND.help: Unconfigure the DHCPv4 relay circuit-id format

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigure the DHCPv4 relay circuit-id format.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to unconfigure the DHCPv4 relay circuit-id format.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# interface Ethernet 12 sonic-cli(conf-if-Ethernet0)# no ip dhcp-relay circuit-id

COMMAND.name: no ip dhcp-relay smart-relay
COMMAND.help: Disable the DHCP smart relay mode

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Disable the DHCP smart relay mode.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to disable the DHCP smart relay mode.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# interface Ethernet 12 sonic-cli(conf-if-Ethernet0)# no ip dhcp-relay smart-relay

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure static ARP.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure static ARP.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# interface Ethernet 0 sonic-cli(conf-if-Ethernet0)# arp ip_addr mac

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigure static ARP.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to unconfigure static ARP.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# interface Ethernet 0 sonic-cli(conf-if-Ethernet0)# no arp ip_addr mac

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Configure IPv4 unnumbered interface by borrowing IPv4 address from the Donor interface.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to configure IPv4 unnumbered interface at the interface level.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# interface Ethernet 0 sonic-cli(conf-if-Ethernet0)# ip unnumbered Loopback1

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Unconfigure IPv4 unnumbered interface.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Use this command to unconfigure IPv4 unnumbered interface at the interface level.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic-cli(config)# interface Ethernet 0 sonic-cli(conf-if-Ethernet0)# ip unnumbered Loopback1 sonic-cli(conf-if-Ethernet0)# no ip unnumbered
